root_cause_hypothesis: The MooreToCore conversion pass converts moore::StringType to sim::DynamicStringType for module port types, but sim::DynamicStringType is not a valid HW port type. When hw::ModulePortInfo constructor calls sanitizeInOut(), the dyn_cast<hw::InOutType> operation fails because sim::DynamicStringType is not compatible with the HW dialect's type system, triggering the assertion 'dyn_cast on a non-existent value'. The getModulePortInfo() function lacks validation to ensure converted port types are valid HW value types before constructing hw::PortInfo.
